name: Nooit Gedacht - Ayurveda Health Resort

reviews.text: I was nicely surprised by the hotel when I arrived. The room was cheap and I expected an average room with average facilities.
reviews.title: Idylic hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I had was probably not the best, but it was clean and in a good condition. But I didn't have a view. It was very basic too. It would have been nice to have a radio or TV and tea making facilities. Though it served it's purpose as somewhere to sleep!
reviews.title: Flies for breakfast anybody?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel setting was perfect. Sitting by the pool, overlooked by a small forest/mountain with the sound of birds and other wildlife was so relaxing. There are lots of trees and plants and it is a little hideway compared to the average looking run of the mill hotels and guest houses closer to the beach.
reviews.title: Beautiful and quiet place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drinking tea on my porch watching a monkey clamber the trees in front of me...lovely.
reviews.title: Not as good as the reviews suggest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am surprised about comments of the staff not being very friendly. I was always greeted with a smile and they always asked how I was an where I had been that day. There are lots of staff working all day, even the ones who didn't speak much English always waved and said hello.
reviews.title: A Sri Lankan haven of tranquility!

reviews.text: The place was very beautiful and well located. Privacy of guests was taken care of. The staff was v co-operative , helpful and nice. The owner, was v helpful to us. The view from my room was superb as it faced the mountain. The bathroom shower was lovely as well. The pool was clean. The location was superb- close enough to the unawatuna beach. The ambience and peace of the hotel was superb as well. The food was v good.
reviews.title: quaint and lovely ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at the end of March, in one of the old rooms which looked out onto the lovely gardens. Very comfortable room - not luxurious but perfectly adequate and pretty good value for the price.
reviews.title: Comfortable and peaceful

reviews.text: Efficient A/C, mosquito nets over the large double bed, good shower etc. and a nice verandah in front with chairs and table.
reviews.title: good location but needs an upgrade
Top notch
reviews.text: 2 swimming pools available and a large pond with water lilies - lots of trees, flowers, birds around, even monkeys occasionally.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent breakfast included - eggs,grilled tomatoes,bacon,toast,fruit,tea or coffee and curd and treacle. Don't leave Sri Lanka without trying curd....delicious.
reviews.title: A nice, quiet and peaceful place to stay

reviews.text: We arrived at this delightful guest house in the late afternoon after a gruelling long journey from Colombo (with a side trip and without using the new highway). We were greeted very warmly with friendly smiles and loved the look of the old architecture. Four of us travelled together neighbours) and so we all booked separate rooms with varying prices. My room was lovely with a patio overlooking the waterlily garden and in a newer block beside the swimming pool, Approaching it however, I wondered if I had been downgraded as the grounds behind the pool (and also in front of our walkway) were overgrown and looked a bit neglected. The other rooms looked as delightful but for less cost, the size is smaller. The airconditioner worked well and quietly (something always worth checking if noise and heat is an issue to get to sleep). Only problem were the dogs barking at night. The walk to the beach was hot and noisy via the main road (10 minutes) as the pathway is too overgrown and takes time to negotiate. Cafes on the beach are good but are accessed beside shops or guesthouses and are difficult to find until you know which one leads to where. The beach was alot smaller than I had remember (since the Psunami) and the surf too strong for me to swim - July is the end of the monsoon season. The meals at the hotel were better than at the beach so we opted for eating here almost every night in a magnificent setting. The service was fabulous.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay in Unawhatuna

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week ind July 2012 and I can only recommend this place.We stayed at the new houses with a/c and the room had what was needed including af great balcony. The view from our window was the pool and a lotuspond where we each morning could see the staff in a little boat collecting flowers. The flowers was used to make new flower patterns in small jars round the hotel and of course to to put on our beds when they made up these:).The new pool was really great both for swimming and playing. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and the food really nice. The hotel is a little walk from the beach but you can always take a tuk tuk and after being at the beach felt at ease to be back in the hotels calm and beautiful surroundings.
reviews.title: Exotic and beautiful place
Beautiful location
reviews.text: The rooms in the New wing are just beautiful and large. Please note that this a no alkohol place - but you CAN bring you own. The main house is old with at Lot of atmospere.
I chose the Nooit Gedacht after reading many positive reviews on this site, and I was not disappointed!
reviews.title: A place where to rest and have a good ayurvedic treatment

reviews.text: I stayed here off season (in June). A good time to get a treatment, because there are not many people around. And, even "off season" you can still have a good time enjoying the sea and the pool... (if you do not mind the occasional - short -rain shower). Only snorkeling is not an option.
reviews.title: Incredible natural healing experience

reviews.text: This was a very nice, though strange, place to stay in. We stayed in a huge, Dutch colonial room. Really beautiful. It is however, a bit far out from unawatuna beach but it is worth the drive. It is also a nice walk through some nice streets with typical houses. The pool wasn't that great (rather small) but the gardens were magnificent as are the buildings
reviews.title: Beautiful colonial retreat

reviews.text: Me and a few friends stayed in a triple room, which was a great value for money. The 'Certificate of Excellence for 2012' given by TripAdvisor (along with other awards) is proudly displayed at the entrance. The staff were friendly, the room was modern, clean and had a small balcony at the back which gives a view to the forest. It's very quiet and green around the resort. Lunch and dinner is available a la carte at reasonable prices.No alcohol is served, so you might find the alcohol shop down the street useful. Although it is not right next to the beach, it is only 3-4 minutes of walking from the resort. As for negative points, I felt the breakfast variety could be improved, since it is a bed/breakfast place. There are two swimming pools and Ayurveda services(for a fee). If you are thinking about getting dinner from the resort, you will have to place your order by 6pm. If you are a late eater, good luck as there are no restaurants around the area and most shops close by 9:30pm-10:00pm. Overall, we found the place nice, and we enjoyed our stay in Unawatuna. A definite recommendation to anyone who is finding a difficult time picking a place, as it is one of the best deals you can get around the seaside town.
reviews.title: Serene and the best value for money

reviews.text: For me this was exactly what I needed after a 15 day adventure tour around Sri Lanka. It was just a beautiful oasis of tranquility. The colonial main building of the hotel was lovely, the bedroom was spotless and was beautifully presented with the a/c working perfectly. The staff was so hospitable and friendly and just could not do enough for you. There were lovely hidden areas of the garden just to sit and read and the pool was large and well maintained. The food was excellent and I stayed for five nights and really enjoyed it all. I also used their spa - fantastic treatments carried out in a lovely quiet area of the hotel. It was a very memorable stay.
reviews.title: Relaxation and Rejuvenation

reviews.text: We had two neighbor rooms so we opened the door and had a suit – perfect when travelling with two kids at 7 and 12. The staff was friendly and the food was great. Breakfast was a bit poor but ok. At 6 pm they knocked at our door to ask if we wanted to have dinner at the hotel or not. We stayed 7 nights and enjoyed it all. Theirs trips were a bit pricy so we didn't try them. I tried a manicure - but they just cut my nails and polished them... I didn't try the other treatments. A great stay after all.
reviews.title: Nice and quit away from the beach

reviews.text: May be we got the unfortunate one - the others look better - but we had unrestful night, lot of noise, small and semi-external bathroom, and a useless air conditioner.
reviews.title: Poor rooms

aka: Nooit Gedacht - Ayurveda Health Hotel Unawatuna
description: Nooit Gedacht is a historical Colonial style villa built in 1735. It was once the country home of a Dutch governor name De jong and was later taken over by the British as a military logistic centre. It is just 10 minutes walk away from the Unawatuna beach & 5 Km from UNESCO world heritage site of Galle fort. Nestling at the foot of Rumassala mountain (referred as Sanjeewani Mountain in the epic of Ramayana ) Nooit Gedacht is situated in the middle of a palm garden full of natural flora & fauna & a lotus lake. Guests can also enjoy traditional Ayurveda treatments, Spa, yoga & meditation while they indulge them selves in the tranquility that this place has to offer. Nooit Gedacht...Your Home in the Sun, is a place with old world charm & modern comforts that you must not miss while you are in Unawatuna!!!
